Cashew___Anthracnose.symptoms: Dark lesions on leaves, stems, or fruits, sometimes with sunken centers.
Cashew___Anthracnose.treatment: Apply appropriate fungicides and remove infected plant parts.
Cashew___Anthracnose.prevention: Use disease-free seedlings, maintain good air circulation, and rotate crops.

Cashew___Gummosis.symptoms: Gum exudation on branches or trunk, dieback of shoots.
Cashew___Gummosis.treatment: Prune infected branches and apply bactericides or fungicides.
Cashew___Gummosis.prevention: Avoid mechanical injury and ensure proper irrigation.

Cashew___Healthy.symptoms: Leaves, stems, and fruits are healthy with no visible disease.
Cashew___Healthy.prevention: Maintain standard cultivation practices and monitor regularly.

Cashew___Leaf_miner.symptoms: Leaves show serpentine tunnels and blotches caused by larval feeding.
Cashew___Leaf_miner.treatment: Use insecticides or neem-based sprays targeting larvae.
Cashew___Leaf_miner.prevention: Regular monitoring and removal of affected leaves.

Cashew___Red_rust.symptoms: Red powdery pustules on leaves and stems.
Cashew___Red_rust.cause: Fungal pathogen that forms rust pustules.
Cashew___Red_rust.prevention: Maintain spacing, remove infected debris, and avoid overhead irrigation.

Cassava___Bacterial_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown and necrotic.
Cassava___Bacterial_blight.treatment: Use bactericides and remove infected leaves.
Cassava___Bacterial_blight.prevention: Plant disease-free cuttings and practice crop rotation.

Cassava___Brown_spot.symptoms: Brown circular spots on leaves leading to defoliation.
Cassava___Brown_spot.treatment: Apply recommended fungicides and remove affected leaves.
Cassava___Brown_spot.prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid waterlogging.

Cassava___Green_mite.symptoms: Yellowing and stunted growth due to mite feeding.
Cassava___Green_mite.treatment: Use acaricides or neem oil sprays.
Cassava___Green_mite.prevention: Regular monitoring and removal of severely infested leaves.

Cassava___Healthy.symptoms: Leaves and stems are healthy, showing no signs of disease.

Cassava___Mosaic.symptoms: Mottled, pale green and yellow leaves with stunted growth.
Cassava___Mosaic.prevention: Use virus-free cuttings and resistant varieties.

Maize___Fall_armyworm.symptoms: Chewed leaves with ragged edges, larvae visible.
Maize___Fall_armyworm.treatment: Use insecticides or biological control agents.
Maize___Fall_armyworm.prevention: Monitor early and remove affected plants if necessary.

Maize___Grasshopper.symptoms: Holes and defoliation caused by grasshopper feeding.
Maize___Grasshopper.prevention: Regular monitoring and use of barriers or netting.

Maize___Healthy.symptoms: Leaves, stems, and cobs are healthy with no visible disease.

Maize___Leaf_beetle.symptoms: Chewed leaves with small holes or skeletonized patterns.
Maize___Leaf_beetle.prevention: Regular monitoring and removal of severely affected leaves.

Maize___Leaf_blight.symptoms: Brown or pale lesions along leaf margins, leaves may wither.
Maize___Leaf_blight.cause: Fungal infection by Exserohilum or Bipolaris spp.
Maize___Leaf_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides and remove infected leaves.
Maize___Leaf_blight.prevention: Use resistant varieties and rotate crops.

Maize___Leaf_spot.symptoms: Small circular spots on leaves that enlarge over time.
Maize___Leaf_spot.prevention: Maintain spacing and avoid water accumulation.

Maize___Streak_virus.symptoms: Yellow streaks on leaves, stunted growth.
Maize___Streak_virus.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and control insect vectors.

Tomato___Healthy.symptoms: Leaves, stems, and fruits are healthy with no visible disease.

Tomato___Leaf_blight.symptoms: Brown spots on leaves, yellow edges, may spread rapidly.
Tomato___Leaf_blight.treatment: Use fungicides and remove affected leaves.
Tomato___Leaf_blight.prevention: Ensure proper spacing and crop rotation.

Tomato___Leaf_curl.symptoms: Leaves curl upwards or downwards with yellowing.
Tomato___Leaf_curl.cause: Tomato leaf curl virus transmitted by whiteflies.
Tomato___Leaf_curl.prevention: Use resistant varieties and control whitefly populations.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small circular spots with dark borders on leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides and remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation and remove debris.

Tomato___Verticillium_wilt.symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of lower leaves, plant stunted.
Tomato___Verticillium_wilt.treatment: Remove infected plants and solarize soil.
Tomato___Verticillium_wilt.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and rotate crops.
